intro: Dyschoriste adscendens, commonly known as the climbing dyschoriste, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with ornamental and medicinal value. The plant is characterized by its twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. It produces small, clustered flowers with white petals and yellow stamens, typically blooming in the summer months. The fruit is a capsule that disperses seeds through wind, contributing to its spread in natural habitats.
